Source code for scripts.controllers.mpc2.robot

import numpy as np



[docs]class Robot:
	def __init__(self, x=0, y=0, yaw=0, v=0, w=0):
		
		# state
		self.x = x
		self.y = y
		self.yaw = yaw # heading angle
		self.v = v  # linear velocity
		self.w = w  # angular velocity
		self.pose = [x, y, yaw]

		# Robot velocity limits
		self.v_max = 0.4
		self.v_min = 0.0
		self.w_max = 1.5
		self.w_min = -1.5

		# robot angular thresholds
		self.steer_max = np.deg2rad(45.0)  # maximum steering angle[rad]
		self.yaw_thresh_v = np.deg2rad(45) # for trajectory speed calculation (speed profile)

		# robot geometric data
		self.wheelbase = 0.5  # distance between the two wheels in meters
        

		# state variables
		self.x_state = np.array([
							[x],
							[y],
							[0]
						  ])

		self.x_dot = np.array([
							[0],
							[0],
							[0]
						  ])



[docs]	def set_robot_velocity(self, linear_velocity, angular_velocity):
		self.update_velocity(v = linear_velocity, w = angular_velocity)
		self.x_dot = np.array([
								[linear_velocity],
								[0],
								[angular_velocity]
								])




[docs]	def update_state(self, dt):
		A = np.array([
						[1, 0, 0],
						[0, 1, 0],
						[0, 0, 1]
					])
		
		B = np.array([
						[np.cos(self.x_state[2, 0])*dt,  0],
						[np.sin(self.x_state[2, 0])*dt,  0],
						[0					 , dt]
					])

		u = np.array([
							[self.x_dot[0, 0]],
							[self.x_dot[2, 0]]
						])
		self.x_state = np.dot(A, self.x_state) + np.dot(B, u)




[docs]	def update_sim(self, dt):
		self.update_state(dt)




[docs]	def update_robot(self, pose):
		self.update_pose(pose)
		self.x_state = np.array([
							[pose[0]],
							[pose[1]],
							[pose[2]]
						  ])



[docs]	def get_state(self):
		return self.x_state, self.x_dot



[docs]	def get_model_pose(self):
		return [self.x_state[0, 0], self.x_state[1, 0], self.x_state[2, 0]]



[docs]	def get_los(self, point):
		xp = point[0]
		yp = point[1]
		x = self.x_state[0, 0]
		y = self.x_state[1, 0]
		theta = np.arctan2(yp-y, xp-x)
		return theta

	

[docs]	def update_pose(self, pose):
		self.x = pose[0]
		self.y = pose[1]
		self.yaw = pose[2]
		self.pose = pose



[docs]	def update_velocity(self, v, w):
		self.v = v
		self.w = w



[docs]	def get_pose_vec(self):
		return [self.x, self.y, self.yaw]

		# return self.pose


[docs]	def get_velocity_vec(self):
		return [self.v, self.w]

		# return self.pose
